content.headline: Canadian FOI structure threatens CAR
content.summary: A discussion on the challenges faced by Canadian reporters in accessing government records compared to their American counterparts, focusing on the limitations imposed by the current Freedom of Information laws in Canada.

content.headline: CAR Trek: Panels set for fall conference
content.summary: An overview of the upcoming CAR Trek conference in Silicon Valley, which will host over 110 experts in computer-assisted reporting to share experiences and guide hands-on training for over 500 attendees.

content.headline: The state of CAR at a small newspaper
content.summary: An account of the challenges and small victories experienced by a mid-sized newspaper staff in implementing computer-assisted reporting, detailing struggles with local government and access to electronic records.

content.headline: Negotiating campaign data
content.summary: Strategies employed by the Philadelphia Daily News to obtain campaign contribution records electronically from gubernatorial candidates, highlighting the hurdles and eventual successes.
